alert.note: Alert for Logan; Pope; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 5:32AM CDT until March 24 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Pope County in central Arkansas... Northern Yell County in central Arkansas... East Central Logan County in western Arkansas... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 532 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Russellville, Danville, Dardanelle, Atkins, Pottsville, Dover, London, Hector, Lake Dardanelle State Park, Mt Nebo State Park, Mosley, Petit Jean River WMA, Lake Dardanelle, Taral, Galla Creek WMA, Happy Bend, Belleville, Havana, Appleton and Corinth. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
